Reviews.Title: “location location”
Reviews.Author: Irene018
Reviews.Content: I found th Russell quite by accident, and what a find it was a an old building refurbed to a quaint hotel, very friendly staff, clean rooms, tiny beds!!! lovely breakfast room and location right in The Rocks, so easy walking to all the sights, great cafes, pubs and restaurants abound, as well as galleries

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Gem in the Rocks”
Reviews.Author: noelglee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. Its ideally located for exploring the old part of Sydney. Of course, it is on George Street. the oldest street in Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely traditional hotel”
Reviews.Author: fyziojo
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we were on a budget, and we're so pleased with our choice. A very short stroll from the ferry, and would only be a five-minute walk from Wynyard train station. The hotel staff were very efficient, the place is very clean and everything is on your doorstep. Our budget choice involved a shared bathroom, but that actually wasn't a problem at all, as it was just across the landing. I would say the only negative thing was the bed, as it was sticking to the traditional theme of the place, it was old and uncomfortable. The breakfast was 'continental', but not just the basic white toast and rice bubbles. An assortment of breads, cereals, boiled eggs and lovely filtered coffee. I'm already looking forward to our next trip to Sydney. Next time I think I might go for a slightly more expensive option and get a larger room - it will still be cheaper than most other options in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy "Olde Sydney" Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Tekweni_Wayne
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic little boutique hotel in Sydneys' Rocks area. The hotel is a renovated original building in the Rocks in Sydney. It is surrounded by restaurants, bars and shops. You are located amongst some of Sydneys' premier tourist sites and everything is nearby. The hotel itself is a renovated original 1800's building. Some rooms have an ensuite, and some use shared facilities. We had a room with an ensuite, that was massive. The room faced the rear of the building over an area known as the Nurses Walk. It was room number 15. Facing the rear meant no city views, but we only slept there, so that was no problem. The room was furnished with older style furniture, but it was all clean, and fresh. On the negative side, there was not a lot of free power points. The room had no fridge. The area got a little noisy at night. There was no free internet. There was very little storage space for toiletries in the bathroom. In defense of the hotel. Old buildings from the era of this building were hardly likely to have been built with modern electronic needs in mind. A small price for such a historic setting in my opinion. The lack of fridge is a little strange, but we got by without one for our 4 day stay. The area is in a restaurant, bar and tourist hub in Sydney, so what do you expect. Get out there and be a part of it! The internet issue is common to most hotels in Australia's large cities. That is just the backward way our hotels operate. As for the bathrooms, they should add more shelving. There was plenty of space. The hotel has an attached restaurant/wine bar. It is important to note that kids are not allowed in there at night. That was ridiculous given that families travel too. Anyway, that just meant that they never got any added value from our stay. all dinners were taken elsewhere. The toilet area by the wine bar also leads to a rear entry to another little gem. "The Fortune of War" pub. It claims to be the oldest pub in Sydney, and may just be. They have live bands on the weekend, and it is a great place to have a beer within the walls of a very historical old pub. Another great feature of the hotel was the roof top garden. This little terrace on the roof offers great photo opportunities, and makes a great place for a BYO drink. The hotel is very convenient to trains, ferries and buses. You really do not need a car if you are staying here. There is a train from the airport and once there, public transport is readily available. My four stars are for the charm of the property, the friendly staff and the location. Others may rate it lower, as the hotel is not abundant with services. But for me, it was 4. The inconveniences are not unexpected in such an old building, but the charm is actually in the age of the building, and the local history. Don't miss the weekend markets, the Museum of Contemporary Art, the Fortune of War pub, the Argyle Pub and wondering around the old historical areas of the Rocks. These things are all available within 5 minutes of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all ways”
Reviews.Author: happyretiree1968
Reviews.Content: Located in The Rocks section of Sydney, The Russell is an ideal location for walking, sightseeing, and catching either the ferries or bus in Sydney. The hotel, built in the 1800's has historic charm and each room is different. Traveling on a budget, we reserved a "shared bath" room and found it to be just fine. The room was small, but they have a lovely sitting room with sofas, comfortable chairs and TV, so we had a very comfortable place to read, play cards, and watch TV -- usually by ourselves. The rooftop garden is also a very nice place to relax when the weather is good. The shared bathrooms are updated and on our floor there were two baths shared by seven rooms. Only once did I have to wait to use the bathroom and then I just went to the next floor -- no big deal. Bathrooms are cleaned several times a day so they always were fresh. They leave the doors to vacant rooms open and encourage guests to give themselves self-guided tours of other rooms. I found many lovely rooms with ensuite bathrooms -- great for those who want to upgrade. Robes, iron and ironing board, and a hot water pot with coffee and tea are provided in each room (instant coffee is typical in hotel rooms in Australia). Breakfast is included and is quite good: hard boiled eggs (still hot), various pastries and bread, fruit, yogurt and granola/cereals, juice and coffee -- what else does one need? Eating out in Australia is very expensive so we figured that The Russell saved us about $25.00/day in food expense. The staff is very friendly and helpful. There is a sign on the Rooftop Garden wall that says, "People arrive here as strangers and leave as friends." Its true.

Reviews.Title: “The Russell a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: daytontraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Russell for 2 nights prior to taking a cruise, It has so much personality and is located in a great location for walking around the heart of Sydney. We made our reservations several months before arriving so we could be sure to get a room. I was concerned about staying in a room with a shared bath but it was not a problem at all. The bathroom was always free when I needed it, sparkling clean and right across the hall from our bedroom. They were kind enought to store our luggage on the last day until we were ready to get on our ship. Everyone at the desk was extremely helpful. Charlie Lumsden really went out of the way to help us out. It was much appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Randalljay
Reviews.Content: I will admit that I am heavily biased to a good location and it's hard to beat this hotel's. But it is a quaint hotel - that means older. Our room was ok in size and the floor squeaked like crazy...but I'd stay here again. It is pricey so it's not a value hotel. Breakfast's were good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel on the Rocks”
Reviews.Author: pem243
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an ideal location, just yards away from Circular Quay - we arrived by train from the airport very easily, despite heavy suitcases. We decided to go for one of the rooms with an en-suite and really wished that we had paid for a bigger "superior" room. And unfortunately they were fully booked when we enquired about upgrading - so get in early! I agree with an earlier reviewer that it's not cheap but then you're paying for the location which is absolutely ideal for getting about. Also it would be a nice gesture to have wifi included in the price but in reality it was only $5 for 24hrs. Breakfast was simple but excellent and we also thoroughly enjoyed a meal in the Wine Bar one evening. Lovely friendly staff on reception.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem For a hotel in the capitol of a city.”
Reviews.Author: viv s
Reviews.Content: this was a great choice easy acsses to the sights for walking,and much more homely than the bland chain hotels,

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: paula-from-nz
Reviews.Content: Loved staying at The Russell Hotel in Sydney, its so close to Circular Quay Ferry's and Trains and its right in the Rocks area with wonderful views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. The staff were very friendly and the room was comfortable and clean. Breakfast was simple but plentiful with fresh fruit salad, yogurt, cereals, various breads (with toaster), croissonts, juices, tea, coffee and hard boiled eggs. This hotel would not be suitable for someone with mobility issues. Although there is an elevator, access to all areas would not be possible potentially as its on multiple levels - I don't think if anyone in a wheelchair could actually get to the reception? We had a shared bathroom which was immediately outside the room door and it was always clean and had fresh bath mats - bath towels were in our room. Dispensers were available with shampoo, conditioner, body wash and over the hand basin, soap and handcream. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming old property but.....”
Reviews.Author: Deirdre R
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, the building is lovely with interesting furniture, the staff are helpful and breakfast was sufficient. The negatives are numerable, however. At $199 for 1 night one would not expect to be sharing a bathroom, hunting for a powerpoint (on a powerboard) under the bed (to boil the kettle on the floor) and fishing around in the bottom of the wardrobe for the tea-making facilities amongst the iron, bathrobes and a hot waterbottle. 'Double-glazing' is provided for you to put in place yourself over the windows in an effort to keep out the noise, however, it is a choice between less noise or some air movement in a very warm room - the celing fan just moved the warm air around. I would not stay at this hotel again even if it was half the price. It is far too noisy to get an adequate sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: alb32
Reviews.Content: The Russell is in a great location, just a short walk to the Harbor Bridge, Opera House and Circular Quay, restaurants and shopping It is a nice old hotel with character. The hotel staff was always very pleasant and helpful, one of the housekeeping staff actually insisted on helping us with our bags on our way out. It has some quirks (it is a maze of various hallways and levels) and some creaky floors but you would expect this at an old hotel, at this price. The wine bar downstairs is good for a late night drink also. Our room was facing the street but the noise was not bad, we did have a portable A/C unit in our room which provided some white noise and kept us cool. Overall, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: harriskris
Reviews.Content: Russell Hotel. Feb 3,4, 5 Good Hotel. If you're looking for the Marriott or the Four Seasons Hotel, this isn't it. However, this is a very charming old hotel located in the popular Rocks area of Sydney. You won't find many of the upscale amenities here, but you will find an excellent staff who will take time with you to answer all of your questions, and give advice about the area. The room was more than adequate, with a good shower and a comfortable bed. This hotel was chosen based on many of the reviews I read on Trip Advisor. The only real negative was that I read about the rooftop garden and how nice it was. Early one morning I went to take a look, and it looked nice, but then I saw two overflowing ash trays. A bit of a turn off. Other than that, I would recommend this hotel to my friends. This was our first trip, to Australia... It was great... But be aware... You will need your wallet !

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: TCAC1
Reviews.Content: Loved the combination of olde world charm, quirkiness, service and location. A really charming little place where I would happily stay again...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms, but small”
Reviews.Author: Maryland1Traveler
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. Location is great - right in the heart of the Rocks. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Sydney for the first time (or second as was my case). Hotel was very clean and the prices quite reasonable for Sydney. Wine bar on the first floor is a nice touch. However, the rooms are very small and not air conditioned. The hallways are quite small also. No parking on site. Breakfast is included but not particularly good. Place has some historic charm but not as much as some others.

Reviews.Title: “Go back in time”
Reviews.Author: greentree33
Reviews.Content: Just prior to taking a cruise that left from the International Passenger Terminal on Circular Quay just a block and a half away, we spent three nights at the Russell and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The hotel was as we imagine hotel accommodation was many years ago, albeit with the addition of a few modern conveniences. Our room was not large but it was comfortable and it was decorated as it would have been years ago, giving it character. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The lack of an air conditioner was made up for with a good ceiling fan and the limited number of rooms, made for a relaxed feel. Given that the hotel has various steps at many locations, persons with limited mobility might be better off to get lodgings in a hotel that is on one floor. The hotel is very close to Circular Key and many good restaurants. It is within an easy walk to the Sydney Opera House, museums, etc. We easily walked with our luggage from the train to the hotel (about two blocks). The train arrives in Circular Quay and is a very quick and easy way to get to the Domestic and International Airport Terminals plus it costs less than a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: margmcc50
Reviews.Content: Situated in The Rocks directly over the road from Circular Quay. Unbeatable location for Opera House and Bridge viewing and a trip to Manly on the Ferry. You can see Ocean Liners docked as you step out of the hotel. Many historical pubs nearby. Pleasant boutique hotel with an excellent wine bar beneath which doubles as the breakfast area in the morning! Fresh flowers in the room and choccies at bed turn time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and "boutique" b&b for visiting Sydney”
Reviews.Author: andreadic
Reviews.Content: Location is just perfect. Ferry, trains, and everything you may want to see in center Sydney is at walking distance. The room was wide enough and confortable, although infrastractures are rather old but they have a personal touch, very nice (and uncommon in Australia I guess). Breakfast (included in a reasonable room rate) was very good with fresh food and good coffee available. The staff at the hotel was always helpful. We managed to change our room that was originally facing an internal court. But both rooms we visited were nice. Internet is available at a reasonable rate of 5$/day, and appeared to be fast. We had a car and we parked in the Wilson parking just below at a 25$/day flat rate discounted for hotel guests (low price for Sydney downtown). I think our choice was perfect for our needs. Maybe calling it "boutique hotel" is too much ;)

Reviews.Title: “Heritage Hotel, superior location, great service, friendly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Ilona154945
Reviews.Content: We feel lucky that we found this hotel, not knowing much about Sydney. It is a five minute walk from Circular Key, the transportation hub in Sydney Harbour. You can catch the train in from the Airport and walk to the hotel in minutes. Very convenient. The hotel is old but has lots of character. Breakfast was perfect and provided with the room. The staff were very helpful and accommodating. Well done Russell Hotel....

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Eric B
Reviews.Content: The Russell is ideally placed for all the main tourist locations in Sydney, with train, ferry and tourbus stops only a short walk away. The staff at the hotel were friendly and very helpful (thank you Elizabeth) - breakfast is provided in the ground floor bar and is to a good standard. The rooms are clean and all have some character due to the age of the building - not a negative point. Our room was en-suite and was excellent, but the rooms that weren't en-suite did look quite small, but if you are using it as a tour base, that shouldn't matter too much. An enjoyable stay in a very nice hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jill c
Reviews.Content: The Russell is in a great location, we could walk to so many places! The train and ferries were close too. Our room was nice and next to the bathroom. I wish they would have had free wifi so we could have chatted with friends back home more often but the wifi cards were reasonable and breakfast was good. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel to be discovered”
Reviews.Author: FernandezMunoz
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Russell for few days prior to our cruise departing from Sydney. Do not expect a spacious chain hotel. Think about more about a big old house with lots of different levels and halls connecting a peculiar array of rooms and facilities. The staff couldn't be friendlier and helpful. The location is the best you could ever dream in Sydney. Across the hotel there is a lovely park from where you have access to the central transportation of the city, the Circular Quay. Across the cove you have the greatest landmark in Sydney, the Opera House and behind the hotel the second best known structure in Australia, the Harbour Bridge, both within walking distance. We loved this small hotel and strongly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: sdolly
Reviews.Content: Located in The Rocks area near Circular Quay, the Bridge and the Opera House. A quirky old hotel but the room was truly the best of this trip.....roomy, comfy and a very helpful staff. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Dandydag
Reviews.Content: Spent a friday night here. The location was tereffic. Plenty to see and do within walking distance. Also very close to circular quay. The hotel is a bit of a rabbit warren,with steps. The room was comfortable. There was a ceiling fan and a portable cooler. I don't know how it would be on a warm night. We enjoyed the breakfast. The hotel has character and the staff were welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: flossy2you
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Russell enroute to NZ for RWC (Go the All Blacks) and found it to be a great location and awesome value for money. Easy walk (2-3mins)from Circular Quay train station from both airports too. Had delicious pizza at Zia Pina down the road first night...next night went to Peter Doyles for their spring special but wished we hadn't... Room was small but adequate; can be noisy in the evening so take some airplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Not good enough.”
Reviews.Author: Fig-Parrot
Reviews.Content: Great spot and all that but bad luck if the TV cable is broken by the staff. Result, no TV unless you want to go to another part of the hotel and share the TV lounge. No fridge either and to boil the jug just plug it in near the toilet, see photo. A 20% discount voucher for their restaurant is not compenstation for shoddy practice either.

Reviews.Title: “I don't think I'll stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Nqueenslander
Reviews.Content: Yes, every room was decorated differently and our room was like a dungeon! We stayed in standard room with shared bathroom. The bathroom wasn't a problem for me, it was big and near by but the room was awful! It was wallpapered in brown, there were only 3 table lamps in whole room, no proper lighting at all and it was very dark. A mirror was position behind the wardrobe in the darkest corner of the room, I couldn't put make up there at all and I was there for the wedding. After the first night I wanted to change the room but my husband thought it was too much bother. Nobody mentioned that there were no TV in standard rooms, so what do you do on rainy night or morning? Yes, read.. we've done a lot of it. To top it off one of the lamps stopped working. I reported it to the reception, nobody bothered to replace it or even check it. Than the cattle stopped working... We didn't enjoy our 4 nights in there. I had to agree with previous comments that it is very noisy location. The hotel is very old and not sound proof, so be prepared to be kept awake with all commotion on the street at night and to wake up with early traffic noise. On Saturday night the second floor was shaking from vibration created by speakers that are installed in bar ceiling. We tried to watch TV in a sitting room above and couldn't even hear TV there.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Lea H
Reviews.Content: We booked via the internet for one night in September 2011 based on the website info and other guest's ratings. Everything we were expecting was exceeded!! From the ease of entry into the Hotel, to the greeting from Elizabeth and the subsequent showing of our room for the night..... to the 20% off discount voucher for the winebar downstairs.... to the extreme comfort of the bed and the room..... everything was there!!! Quite literally, we were amazed!! We peeped into other rooms while we were exploring and it is incredible that every room is decorated differently!! Even when leaving the following day we were amazed by the service delivered by Elizabeth!! She minded our suitcases while we went exploring and then called us a taxi to the wharf when we needed it. Service at its best!! We were so happy, that we have re-booked to return to The Russell next February, 2012, for our pre-cruise night ..... and we are so looking forward to repeating our experience!!!! Thankyou to Elizabeth and staff for making our stay in Sydney an experience that we want to repeat!!! Warwick and Lea (the lady with 2 broken wrists!!)... can't wait to see you again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprise Package in the heart of the Rocks”
Reviews.Author: fishfamily5
Reviews.Content: Just one night to stay in Sydney and we, my friend and I, spent it staying at this amazing, quaint boutique hotel that also served a great breakfast in the morning. The decor, the staff, the rooms, the atmosphere, the shared spaces and courtyards, the views; we could not fault it for the price which was very reasonable. And in addition to all this was the location, location, location. Less than 5 minutes walk from Circular Quay train station and ferry terminals. Very easy access to the Opera House, the Harbour Bridge and the historic Rocks areas. The Rocks Sunday Market was great fun with amazing stalls of crafts, food, souvenirs, etc. We would certainly consider staying here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Curly003
Reviews.Content: I stayed for just one night at the Russell in Sydney in July. Location was perfect walking distance to the opera house and also the week-end market, the bus stop was right there. My room was tiny but cozy. Clean place too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hospitality”
Reviews.Author: LaurieSA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Russell in Sydeny for three days last month, and was delighted at the accommodation. As a young woman travelling alone, you always hope to feel safe and secure in a clean, friendly and atmospheric hotel. This is what I got. The location is spot on! Literally next door to the major train station, over the road from the Bay and the Opera House, and a super wine bar and restaurant on the lower levels. What more could a girl ask for? A special mention must be made of Elizabeth, who was a wonderful and friendly host during my stay. She is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Location and customer service makes this a specia place”
Reviews.Author: QueenBee0301
Reviews.Content: Hotel located at The Rocks within walking distance of the Opera House. Rooms spacious and decorated beautifully; breakfast provided. Could not have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect if you know what you want”
Reviews.Author: Rahsaan
Reviews.Content: Our three-night stay at The Russell was just what my wife and I wanted. It is by no means a fancy hotel but you cannot beat the location or the price. It is right in the Rocks by the Quay and is minutes from lots of top restaurants, We opted for a room that shared a bathroom which is an immediate turn off for some but not for us. It was immaculate and never unavailable in three days. Our room was small but there are lots of other more space and in-room bathrooms. They have a lovely rooftop garden and wonderful sitting room. Breakfast is downstairs in the wine bar and is just enough. Because this is in the heart of a busy tourist and nightlife area, it can get noisy at night as people clear out of the bars and pubs. But for us, just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, but dont count on sleep before 1am”
Reviews.Author: JoakimJonsson
Reviews.Content: Really nice little hotel, however what I miss from the reviews on the site is the fact that the hotel is right above a very loud bar/pub. On Friday and Saturday I didnt get any sleep ahead of 2am and on Tuesday it was very loud until late at night. It seems as if they were playing in my room and even the sound of peoples voices come through. Not your place if you want to rest ahead of an important day and are a light sleeper. They charge $5 for internet access per day, which is quite a lot, I dont expect to be charged that much for basic internet access. The hotel is very cute though and service very good. Toilet in the coridor makes it a bit awkard to go out in the middle of the night. Breakfasts were the absolute bare minumum, so dont expect much for the first meal of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, excellent location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Emilia100
Reviews.Content: A perfect place to spend a short break in Sydney. We stayed for four nights. Our room was very clean and comfortable, and had character. We were cosy and warm and slept well each night. The shower was brilliant too. Good value for money. Chocolates left on the bed each night were a lovely touch.

Reviews.Title: “Sydneys own Fawlty Towers”
Reviews.Author: GDay79
Reviews.Content: I kept looking for Basil or Manuel to carry my bags for me. You do need an open mind when visiting The Russel and if you are to take away the maximum experience you need to realise that it is an old building in an old part of town. They have tried to capitalise on this by keeping the rooms and decor in period but it runs the risk of coming across as just old. Our room was basic with a double bed on suite with a television on a desk, kettle with tea and coffee, clothes iron, telephone and a desk. We did not have aircon but it was winter and an oil heater was provided. The daily housekeeping was good at keeping things clean and tidy but our seat cussions were stained and the carpets were due replacement. A few water stains on the wall could have been seen to. Breakfast is in the wine bar below the hotel and is a classic buffet breakfast of cerial, yogurt, croissants, toast, coffee and juice. The hotels winning appeal however is its location. Wow! And it is for this reason why I would choose to stay there again should I find myself in Sydney. You roll out of bed onto the ferrys, trains, busses and bustelling energy of The Rocks. Sydney is never more accessable than from The Rocks and staying on its doorstep is worth turning a blind eye to the 'quaintness' of the hotel, considering you'll be out enjoying Sydney and only really returning there to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected..can't wait for our next stay!”
Reviews.Author: lexia1632
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay, loved everything about it. The staff were helpful and friendly. The superior room that we stayed in was a generous size with ensuite and an adjoining court yard.The Russell Hotel is a charming, old style, cozy B&B. With Russell wine bar/restaurant downstairs you couldn't ask for more. Pleasant atmosphere, nice wine/beer, great food and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful experience... and what great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Ros094
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent two nights at The Russell and loved everything about the place... it was so nice to experience such friendly... and what l would call "old-fashion country hospitality" in the heart of Sydney. The room was small without private facilities, but this was our choice, based on price.... who needs a big room when we were there to explore The Rocks! Everything was spotlessly clean with delightful homely touches such as fresh flowers in our room and chocolates on the pillows. The location could not have been more central...right in The Rocks, walking distance to great eating places ...and Circular Quay across the road!! Plus a beautiful Endota Spa right next door. We'll certainly be back if coming to Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “a little gem, right in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: VancouverStephanie
Reviews.Content: We chose the Russell hotel because of its proximity to Circular Quay and the Opera House. It was perfect! It is really small, but charming. Each room is different,witih quirky old-fashioned furniture. These are small rooms, with not a lot of modern conveniences, so the closet is an old-fashioned wardrobe. But the bathrooms were brand new and modern, and the shower was excellent. our deroom did not have an ensuite bathroom, but the hotel provides big fluffy white bathrobes for you to use when going to the bathroom.(You can pay extra and get an en-suite). There is a new elevator, so you don't have to carry your bags up the stairs any more. But the best thing is the location.... you are within a stone's throw of Circular Quay, just across a tiny park and beside the Museum of Modern Art. Could not be better. The hotel is also at the start of the Rocks, so you can stroll out to find a restuarant or pub on the Rocks. Ignore the first few you come across, these are a bit touristy, particularly the cheap pizza joint. Climb a bit further and they are more interesting. A German-style beer garden is good, and we found an ancient pub at the very top of the hill, which proclaims itself as Sydney's oldest, and they served great beer--- try the "3 Sheets" -- and pub food. Also worth a stroll are the cafes near the small harbour, on your way to the Sydney Harbour Bridge. There is a masted sailing ship amongst the cafes.... The downside of this hotel would be the lack of air conditioning, not a problem for us as we don't like aircon, but the quay can be noisy at night, and open windows mean that you do hear some noise at night. But in the morning you forget about all that as you go downto the breakfast which is included in the price.This is served in a newly re-vamped wine bar on the ground floor.You can look out at the Quay as you enjoy a great breakfast of croissants, fruit, yoghurt, tea or coffee, with a copy of the Sydney Morning Herald. It was so good it was hard to pull oursleves away to start the day.The Wine Bar is a great evening location too. If you are not dependent on the usual American style of luxury bedrooms, choose the Russell for a really charming experience right in the heart of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!! Hotel not a boutique hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: margreet71
Reviews.Content: The room and bathroom were big but not nice. The breakfast which was included was absolutely below zero. When we came around 09.30 hrs there was nothing left. We will be in Sydney in November again but will not stay in the Russels.

Reviews.Title: “Don't worry - be Happy!”
Reviews.Author: samdogNY
Reviews.Content: Oh my god I may have to share a bathroom! --- Don't worry, this is NOT a hostel or anything even close. This beautiful quaint hotel is far more akin to a B&B. What a great location, adjacent to Circular Key train & boat terminal with soo many bars, restaurants, and cool features of the Rocks at your doorstep! Look, the "negative" points such as small rooms are really part of the charm. You are paying a lot less to stay in a premire area with easy access to transport and entertainment, so who cares if teh room is small and there is no TV - seriously, just doesnt matter. Also - $5/day for the wireless internet is just another reason to stay here. I hope they keep that price as it was a selling point. The breakdfast in the down stairs bar (which is a lively wine bar at night) was simple and effective. The "sitting" room provied a nice area with a balcony , books, and a tv if you so desired. We were in Syndey for 2 days on a stopover to other parts of Australia and definitely made the right call by staying at the Russell

Reviews.Title: “Central, quirky, comfortable and always welcoming”
Reviews.Author: KateyRead
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Russell at least every year for the past 5 years or so. It is oh so convenient, so comfortable, the staff are always welcoming and nothing is a problem for them. Breakfast is casual but tasty and good value. The Russell is near Circular Quary, the trains and easy walking distance to many attractions. A hidden and historic treasure.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good, Not Bad, Just Cozy”
Reviews.Author: SlainVic94
Reviews.Content: The Russell was a delightful, tiny, and a little warm. My wife and i weren't planning on spending any waking hours in our room so it was perfect for us in value. If your the kind of traveler that desires space, air conditioning and posh amenities, this is NOT your hotel. Otherwise, it's the best back for the buck in the Rocks

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Suprise !”
Reviews.Author: Melbournegal
Reviews.Content: I can't speak highly enough of this quaint little boutique hotel! My sister and I were looking for a hotel near the International Port in Circular Quay for a one night stay as we were meeting friends disembarking from a cruise early the next day. We originally shied away from The Russell because of it's star rating and because the rooms available were not en-suite and we would have to share a bathroom. However, after checking out photos of the hotel on the web, and seeing the prices of several other hotels in the area, we decided to take a chance and stay overnight in the hotel because of the excellent location for our needs and because of the excellent value. The room was $140 for a double, including breakfast compared with the next cheapest hotel we could find which was $308 for the same. We caught a train from the airport to Circular Quay (6 stops = $15) and made our way to the Russell Hotel which is in The Rocks area. It was approximately a 10 minutes stroll from the train and the Hotel only 6 minutes walk from the Port which is in the next street. The hotel was such a surprise! After putting our luggage in our room, we decided to have dinner in the restaurant on the ground floor. I can't speak highly enough of the presentation and quality of the food, not to mention the friendliness of the staff. The bedroom we stayed in was a double on the second floor. The room was spotlessly clean and well equipped and lovingly decorated in period style. Bathrobes were supplied, along with white fluffy towels, tea and coffee making supplies and chocolates on our bed which was turned down for the night. The Hotel is on a busy street and you can hear the traffic and the ferry horns if you leave the window open. This was not a problem for us but it might be for some during warmer weather. There is a ceiling fan but no airconditioning which could be uncomfortable in very hot weather, again no problem for our stay. The two bathrooms on our floor were spotless, one being especially large and recently renovated with a double shower. The lady who checked us in was extremely friendly and helpful. There is a guest lounge complete with comfortable couches and a large screen TV, and on the top floor is a lovely private roof garden. The Hotel corridors are quite narrow but almost all are lined with windows so it's very bright, and they have a modern, very fast lift which is very important because there are LOTS of quite narrow stairs which would otherwise be a problem for older or less moble travellers. The best suprise was the buffet breakfast in the restaurant - a light breakfast but beautifully presented and regularly restocked. The background music was discreet and again, the staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly. My sister and I were so impressed with the Hotel that we intend to return later in the year with our husbands for a longer stay to allow us to explore The Rocks area more fully and enjoy the ambience of the Hotel. Excellent value and a very positive experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “location excelent hotel so-so”
Reviews.Author: octaviaillawarra
Reviews.Content: Booked into Russell as convenient for my American guests. Newly installed lift relieved stair hazard, Rooms were adequate and we shared a bathroom between us. Both rooms were hot and airless although the ceiling fan helped a little. lack of refridgeration was a pest as we needed cool water to rehydrate after hot days. We certainly didn't have a coffee making machine. Lack of towels was also annoying-one per person although the bathrobes were appreciated. Overall the rooms could be described as tired. On the plus side-breakfast was excellent the fresh fruit salad appreciated and excellent coffee. Free newspapers enabled us to catch up-our extra small tv just didn't work although the flat screen in the other room was a little better. The breakfast waitress was very pleasant. Overall the accommodation was over-priced but the location is superb and if little time is planned to be spent in the room, go for it. One final word-take ear-plugs-it can be noisy at weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Compared to other Boutique Hotels I found The Russell disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Thierre
Reviews.Content: When booking I realized the Hotel was being refurbished and therefore expected the air conditioning to be at least adequate. This was not the case and having arrived in Sydney on the hottest day recorded for 100 years I instantly regretted the arrangement. We were expected to sleep in a very small room with window open to its max and a ceiling fan to keep us cool - this proved to be totally inadequate. The room itself was too small for two people having to step over a suitcase to have access to the bed. Our shower room (situated close by down the corridor) was tiny making it difficult to dry off without causing an injury. I am an average size 12 female. Having attempted to raise the issues with the receptionist I found her to be off handed and arrogant with no tollerance to listen. My experience at the Russell was over a 4 night stay - a party of 4 occupying 2 standard rooms with a shared bathroom. Had I been able to make other arrangements at short notice I would have but this was not possible.

Reviews.Title: “Small, quaint hotel in the heart of the Rocks.”
Reviews.Author: cream01
Reviews.Content: A lovely, small hotel in the Rocks district, two minutes walk from Circular Quay and only metres away from all that the Rocks has to offer. Still undergoing some major renovations but this didn't impede on our stay except for the lack of a lift when hauling the luggage in and out. Small rooms could perhaps benefit from air conditioning especially in the height of summer and perhaps a chest of drawers instead of an armchair would be more useful. Staff were brilliant, very helpful and friendly and the chocolates on the pillows every night were lovely. Perhaps not a hotel for the unfit because of all the different levels caused by combining several buildings but for us this only added to the uniqueness of the hotel. A pleasant change from all the other charactorless hotels we have stayed in. Will definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Oprea House and Bridge on your doorstep.”
Reviews.Author: Abskii
Reviews.Content: The friendly staff and charming, characteristic rooms just add to that fantastic location! Breakfast in the morning was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “location great but noisy, rooms more shabby than chic, staff charmless”
Reviews.Author: EKH155
Reviews.Content: the noise was not always the hotels fault although they could consider the sleeping guests before emptying bottles under the bedroom windows at 4.30am. When challenged about this the receptionist said " I don't drink it is nothing to do with me" Price does not reflect comfort or service when on some days it can be matched or beaten by a real hotel just around the corner. Guests should be warned that the hotel have no problem charging the full price for rooms with scaffolding outside the window - " the workers don't start til 7.30AM"

Reviews.Title: “Run!”
Reviews.Author: backin5minutes
Reviews.Content: Dear Traveller, if you seek quality accomodation at an affordable price, look here. The Russell Hotel promised to provide a boutique venue for sleeping and whiling away the downtime found in the average travel day. Alas, we were so terribly disappointed! My mother and I had booked very early in May 2010, for mid-October 2010. This five day trip to Sydney was to be a graduation gift for me from my parents to congratulate my recent degree. We had planned for months and confirmed our reservation after trawling through hundreds of sites and hotel reviews. We recieved a confirmation via email for a DOUBLE room for us to share. As posted on their website, it clearly states that all rooms have double beds - we did not mind bunking together to save a few bucks! The day prior to our departure for Sydney we rang to confirm credit details. After some confusion it was discovered that an "error" had been made with our booking, and we were booked in a SINGLE room, for the duration of our stay. Apologies were made and we were eventually offered a room upgrade for nights 1 and 3, but would have to stay in a single room with a roll out bed for nights 2 and 4. Our rate would be discounted. However, we would have to move rooms every night, and the single rooms were reported to be so small that a roll out bed would leave standing room only in the room. For the reduced price of $100 AUD per night, this was ridiculous. May I remind the traveller that this booking error was ENTIRELY THEIR FAULT - which they readily admitted to. We decided that for the price were paying, we would not be happy with these less than satisfactory arrangements. We requested they find us somewhere else to stay. They refused. The day before we were due to leave, we were now expected to find our own accomodation in a city that was nearly booked out. We were offered a room in KINGS CROSS (a known 'red light district') for the same price as a boutique hotel in The Rocks - a trendy and centrally located area in the CBD. We declined. I am sad to say that this experience nearly ruined our trip entirely - accomodation being pretty essential when travelling. For what was supposed to be a real treat, girl's week in Sydney, this was appalling. Fortunately we were able to secure our own accomodation that was OK. However, the flippant attitude of the Russell Hotel staff and their refusal to assist us was unbelievable. I have never encountered such a blatant disregard for a situation they caused themseleves. The offer of a cramped room and four room changes for only a small reduction in price was absurd and rude considering the way we wanted to spend our holiday. Appalling. Find somewhere else rather than risking a complete failure in customer service and basic courtesy. Disgusted.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint”
Reviews.Author: Irene018
Reviews.Content: The Russell hotel is a hidden gem in The Rocks area. As long as you are petite like myself you will find the beds quaint. Breakfast included in the deal is more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: mauri-BJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in Russell hotel with my family and it was a pleasant stay. I booked at the last moment for 1 night, but due to a sickness of my 4 years old daughter I had to pospone of some days the booking and then I booked for 2 nights by phone. The owner has been more than honest and very helpfull with us. Even if I changed the booking less than 24h before the first missed stay she didn't charge anything for that night. The location is an old stylish building and our room was big and well decorated. The rooms are at the upper floor without elevator so we left the baby stroller downstairs. Not suggested for wheelchairs or families that want to take their baby car into the room. The location is really central and it is easy to reach by foot the Opera house and to walk in the Rock. The cooked breakfast was good. I definitely recommend this small hotel for the friendlyness, the offered service and the position. Considering the average cost the the other hotels in this area it is very competitive and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, good breakfast; great, helpful reception staff; generally the hotel could do with a make-over.”
Reviews.Author: Bullshot
Reviews.Content: Stairs very steep. Very central location, could hardly be better.

Reviews.Title: “OK, if you are on a tight budget”
Reviews.Author: fisherontour
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for location, as we needed somewhere inexpensive to stay for a couple of nights, after a long overnight journey, that was within a flat walk from Circular Quay. We were basically passing through Sydney, but had to stay over as we had tickets for a gig at the Opera House. The Russell ticked all the boxes with regard to location. It is probably the best located hotel in The Rocks as it is situated at quay level. Most of the other (more expensive) establishments are up the steep hill or flights of steps. However this is a tired, budget hotel so your expectations should be set low with regard to rooms and facilities. (For instance there was no in-room safe in our room - so you have to remember to collect your passports from the reception safe, as the receptionist does not remind you!!!). If you want somewhere smarter you can expect to pay 3-4 times the room rate (as we did later in our trip around OZ). I would only recommend this hotel if you need to stay, but not as part of a holiday. If you need to get some sleep, ask for a room as far away as possible from the pub next door, as this gets very noisy on Friday and Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, disappointing, disappointing”
Reviews.Author: kesEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Apparently our socks would be knocked of by this charming hotel. Our socks stayed most firmly on. Last hotel in a three week trip and by far the worst. Very very poor room - a deluxe room with ensuite - to be fair it looked the worst of the ones we could see though open doors. It badly needed overhauling. My husband could not fit in the bathroom. Shabby and hot - poor aircon. The only unfriendly service we had over breakfast in Australia was here - pretty basic breakfast. Reception staff very friendly and helpful. Small narrow staircase to carry heavy bags up to reception - was difficult and would be near impossible for elderly guests. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: johnru
Reviews.Content: The hotel has plenty of character. The room was small but nicely furnished. You do have to walk up a couple of flights of steep stairs, which I wouldn't fancy with small kids, or for anyone with walking difficulties. Breakfast was brilliant, plenty of hot and cold choice. Wasn't a fan of the shared bathroom, that said, they were close to the rooms and i didn't have to wait to use them. They were always very clean. The have a laptop in reception which you can use for free, which was very useful. Staff were very friendly. The big plus for this hotel is the location, seconds from the harbour, Bridge and Opera Hse, great selection of shops. So easy to find, about 5 mins walk from Circular Quay station - just come out of the station, on the road side, turn right, walk up to the traffic lights, turn right and it is just along there.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in town!”
Reviews.Author: DemainDeslAube
Reviews.Content: Very best location of all hotels in that price range in Sydney. It is true that the hotel is a little "tired" as some reviewers have noted, but this is more than made up by the helpfulness of the staff and some very nice touches; fresh flowers in each room, coffee-maker with *real* coffee in the room, chocolate on the pillow, extra clean bathroom. And of course, the location is perfect, less than 2 minutes walk from Circular Quay, the Bridge and the Rocks. Yes, was a bit noisy, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: UkWoodside
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December 2009 in the two large rooms at the front - the suite and the studio. Rooms are reasonably spacious for an old building, but very basic and tired by way of furnishings. This adds to the character, to some extent, but for the price the rooms are just that bit too grotty. That said, the staff is very helpful indeed, both at the front desk and in the breakfast room. The waiter at breakfast gave us some great inside tips on things to do which we would not have gleaned from guidebooks. The room for breakfast is extremely pleasant, with large windows looking onto the bustling street outside. The hotel is right by Circular Quay, so ferries to the Zoo (a must!), Manly, Watson's Bay etc are right on hand. Lean out of the front and you can see the Harbour Bridge dominating the view at the end of the street. So what makes this hotel most worthwhile is its location - as others have said, right in the centre of the Rocks, but for us just as importantly right by the ferry terminal. Rooms at the front are not quiet - the Rocks is a centre for nightlife and we were woken a fair bit by drunks outside and dustbin lorries collecting bottles, but then it is in the centre of a large city, so this sort of thing is to be expected. Would we go back? Yes, no question, but if you book this hotel do accept that for all its age and character, this is not a luxury option.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it for New Years”
Reviews.Author: KCCarroll
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Sydney for the New Years Holiday. The Russell was perfect. It was in the heart of The Rocks, with a roof-top view of George Street / Circular Quay. The service was gracious and the food was good. If you are looking for a full-service "Hyatt-type" hotel, the Russell is not for you. We loved staying in a traditional Australian hotel, simple and hospitable. The price is worth the location. It's a two block walk from the airport train. Also, we did not have an ensuite bathroom. This was not a problem. The shared baths were clean--and during a 3-day stay we rarely waited. The Russell is in the heart of Sydney. If you need quiet, look elsewhere. If we are ever in Sydney again, especially for New Years, we will be at the Russell.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of cockroaches”
Reviews.Author: Dora1983
Reviews.Content: We travelled a long way from Europe to share our room with a huge cockroach that sat nicely on the wall by the window. It was a very disappointing experience, especially when you travel with small children.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel- location location”
Reviews.Author: travellingforfun1
Reviews.Content: Hi, we stayed here as we were going to a wedding in the 'Rocks". Yes we are Sydney Siders. Hubby and I stayed here as we didnt want to drive the 1 hour trip home. We thought the Russell is a perfect location for a weekend away, and it didnt dissapoint. The rooms a little small for my liking, but you cannot fault the brilliant location. its just a minute walk away from everything Sydney has to offer, (Opera house, Rocks, resturants, pubs, etc). They have a rooftop garden and you can look out to the harbour, its was very lovely and quaint. Its slightly more expensive than other Hotels in the area, but you are paying for the fantastic Location. If your want to be central to the Rocks - this is it. You cant get any closer- and the breakfast was really good too. There is a little breakfast room downstairs that is beautiful. If you want old skool Sydney this is the place- quaint, clean, close to everything, location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JemWiltshire
Reviews.Content: We arrived early on a Sunday morning after a very long flight from Heathrow. We didn't expect to have access to our room, but had previously requested if we could book in and drop of our luggage. Imagine how pleased we were to not only be able to book in but be shown to our room which was ready for us. Our room was beautiful, lovely and clean with the best hotel shower we have used in a long time. The staff were welcoming, friendly and polite and I couldn't fault the location of the hotel. To sum up our 3 nights spent at The Russell, we thoroughly enjoy it and it just added to the brilliant time we had in Sydney .

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Kimby-MT
Reviews.Content: We picked this place based on reports from other travellers and were not disappointed. Far from it! Though we could not afford a room with ensuite bath, our 135 AUD room shared a bath with only one or two other rooms and we never had to wait for a shower or toilet. (There were actually several bathrooms we could choose from in the event that one was busy.) The Russell's rooms - we peeked in many open doors - were all unique and reminded us of Grandma's house, with antique furnishings and period wallpaper. Though on the small side, our room (#4) was well furnished with a large wardrobe, a glass topped desk/table with chair, a large mirror, two night stands with reading lamps, a side dresser with about 18 drawers (an antique filing cabinet of sorts), an overhead fan and a large window with venetian blinds. The only thing we could have asked for is a sink in the room. A stay at the Russell includes breakfast in their lower level dining room (no longer a restaurant open to the public). Everyone gets fruit, cereal and yoghurt along with coffee or tea, plus a choice of other options including croissants or eggs. The hotel also has a lovely communal sitting room with TV and balcony with a sidelong view of the Harbor Bridge, and a roof top terrace with seating for 8 or so under umbrellas. The Russell is a 2-minute walk from the Circular Quay train station and ferries, and couldn't be more convenient for those impromptu evening strolls a first time visitor to Sydney can't get enough of. We really enjoyed Sydney, and a big part of that was due to the location and comfort of our hotel. One tip: Although a shuttle from the airport is a great way to get TO the Russell, I would recommend only booking it one-way. It is much faster to take the train back to the airport, IF you have a manageable amount of luggage. It's a 2 minute walk to the Circular Quay station, and once you are on the train, it's only 12 minutes to the airport. Our shuttle ride took almost an hour, and duplicated the scenic route it took on the way into town, stopping at multiple hotels to pick up other passengers. Plus we had to get on the shuttle at 11 am for a 3:05 pm flight, a waste of time that could be better spent on our last morning in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Central location in comfort”
Reviews.Author: Dave_and_Victoria
Reviews.Content: Booked The Russell after reading TripAdvisor reviews and we weren't disappointed. Excellent location for seeing Sydney - 5mins walk from bedroom to Harbour Bridge and Opera house. Not expensive but a comfortable room with standard facilities. The ceiling fan was particularly welcome when we arrived from UK snow to Aussie heat. Breakfast was good - try the mixed breads basket!

Reviews.Title: “Cant beat the location”
Reviews.Author: mlperkins
Reviews.Content: So we booked months in advance for new years 2008/09. All together there were 13 of us, using 2 rooms and a suite. Extortionate prices but then we were expecting that! You cant beat the location. Absolutely amazing. On Russell street (good shopping area) opposite ciruclar quay (for the boat tours ect) and a wicked view of the opera house!!! Step outside the hotel and a view of the bridge. Priceless!!! The hotel is easy to find, no aprking directly for the hotel although they have rates for nearby carparks. The hotel is a quaint old boutique hotel. Soe of the rooms needed some work, some needed a bit more of a clean. The rooms really seemed to vary as did the bathrom facilities so i suppose its just pot luck. The suite, or so they called it was basically a double room with a sofa bed that just about slept 2 little kids! Having the en-suite was nice though. The hotel has a lounge and a blacony which overlooks the harbour. Again priceless. They kindly arranged babysitters for us on a few occasions with lcoal agencies - they were a godsend! We were on the harbour for new years fireworks, but accoridng to the babysitter from the balcony was the best view. If you are there for new yeasr please be aware the hotel is in the exclusion zone and is very noisy!!!! The restaurant downstairs served breakfast for guests only. It was a very random choice of breakfast, but you could pay for extras such as a full english (my brother couldnt resist!) We had a loveely stay, we were made very welcome, the staff tried to help us as much as they could...New years in Sydney was amazing but honestly the hotel was average.

Reviews.Title: “I love the Russell!”
Reviews.Author: cyberbob2000
Reviews.Content: I just love The Russell Hotel in Sydney. Everything about it is perfect. The rooms are lovely, each room has a different design. The beds are very comfortable, each room comes with a big cupboard, an ironing board and a tea-making corner. The rooms to the side and the back are very quiet - I've never had a room out to George Street. The staff is very professional, helpful and friendly. The stairs are very steep and narrow and they help you carry some of your luggage, if you're having trouble. They also allow you to use the internet for free, as long as it's only for a few minutes. The breakfast is on the ground floor and it's very god value. There's a buffet and a series of warm dishes, all included in the price of the room. Last, but for sure not least, the location. The Russell Hotel is situated on George Street at the beginning of The Rocks, the old town of Sydney. All the major sights are withing walking distance and Circular Quay, the main transport hub, is just a couple of minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: Eric99508
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Russell. It's a quaint old boutique hotel in The Rocks district near Circular Quay in 0ld Sydney. It was right in the middle of everything we were doing: old Sydney, catching public transport at Circular Quay, dining at the Sydney harbor, looking out over the Opra House. It is kind of creaky and old, but it was clean and confiortable once we lugged our bags up the narrow staircase. Very coold older hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: bnowlin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Russell and loved it. Early morning walks around the Opera House and Botanical gardens were magical. Lots of good places to eat within walking distance. Hop on the ferry to Manly or Bondi for the day. This place is more like a B&B than a regular hotel. The stairs up are narrow and steep. If you have lots of luggage, it is difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Untidy, Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: sallyinoz
Reviews.Content: First impressions were "oh no, what have we done!" The front door was old and dirty and unwelcoming, the experience didn't get any better!! The stairs were old and dirty and no help was offered as we did numerous trips up and down with baby, cot, and luggage. The room was no better, my heart sank when I saw it. Old and quaint it wan't. The furnishings were old and shabby, not antique! the soft furnishings were from the 80's I guess, just hideous! There were panes of glass leaning against the walls under the windows so you had to reach over them to see out. They should have been out of the room in storage, not on the floor. There was a heater sat in the room which we didn't need so that could have been outside somewhere. There were wires all over the floor looking untidy. The carpet was the cheapest carpet I have seen (Ive seen it in shops) The kettle was in the wardrobe and you had to fill it up from a dirty shared bathroom..............no thanks!! There was no charm at all to the room. just old and grotty. The bathroom got worse, it smelt and the window looked into an interior cavity filled with litter, dirt and it smelt too. There was grime on the hand wash and lotion, the bottles looked like they had been refilled for years. The window sill had engrained dirt, and the wooden blinds were greasy with dirt. It didn't smell or feel clean at all. Antique fittings and tiles can still be cleaned!!! Not here though! We had a walk around the hotel, it was all the same, untidy and unloved. It felt dead and all the other guests looked unhappy too. A HUGE dissapointment. Really, find somewhere else to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Awful place, stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: kaztin
Reviews.Content: I wanted a nice character hotel to have a lovely w/e away. What we got was a dirty pokey room, lumpy mattress and pillows, dirty carpet, thick dust, very small room, no place to put anything. The tea and coffee making facilities were a joke, in a wardrobe and the kettle lead got very hot when used - dangerous! NO AIRCON! Something to consider in the heat of the Summer. It was very muggy and the ceiling fan was a joke. Noisy position, and we didnt sleep a wink. Creaking floor boards and you can hear everything from other rooms.Tiny little TV with poor reception. Breakfast was included but be warned, there is limited choice to what the other menu reads, and any extras (such as bacon) need to be paid for. I found the whole experience a nightmare, didn't sleep, very uncomfortable and for $245 a night (for standard double with ensuite) not good value for money. My advise would be-DONT STAY HERE! It ruined our weekend so much so, we only could stand one night, and of course they didn't give us the money back for the 2nd night. Be warned, in this case, boutique doesnt mean charming and quaint, but dirty and dingy!

Reviews.Title: “Find some place else!”
Reviews.Author: HKGTraveller53
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is terrific, but the facility is extremely tired. Do not believe the claims regarding the â€œcharmâ€� of its 1887 origins. Many of the furnishings may date to 1887, but this place can hardly be described as charming.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: LauraLHill
Reviews.Content: The Russell hotel was fantastic! We had a wonderful experience there in November. If you're into small, boutique-like places to stay this is for you! It's in a perfect location to see Sydney; close to the ferries, Opera House, and bridge. It does have stairs only leading up to the reception and the rooms are fairly small, so don't expect a 5 star hotel. (Definately go with the rooms with bathrooms in them!) But, it was very comfortable and clean and was everything we had hoped for. The rooftop garden was also very cozy and pleasant and a nice place to have a glass of wine at the end of the day! We also found the staff very friendly and helpful. They arranged airport transfers for us and recommended places to eat and to visit in the city. The breakfasts were also very good every day with a lot of selections. If you want to stay in the Rocks this is definately a great place for a great rate. (Especially compared to some of their overpriced neighbors!)

Reviews.Title: “Not for us”
Reviews.Author: Bensafrimboy
Reviews.Content: We have learned a sharp lesson about 'boutique hotels' in Sydney. It means old fashioned, not particularly clean, very jaded, and very poor facilities. We had booked in here for a few nights, arriving at 7.00am early morning we did not expect access to our room but at least somewhere where we could freshen up. We were told to use one of the communal bathrooms but had to wait for an hour for other residents to use it. When we eventually got in there we found broken taps and the whole room was awful. I had lugged our cases up a rickety staircase barely wide enough for a case and in full view of people eating in the snack room. I was absolutely knackered. We were told to leave the cases by the desk but there was no real welcoming for us. My wife managed to get a peep into one of the rooms and then declared that under no circumstances would she stay there. It cost us the deposit but what a relief, except for the fact that I had to get the cases down those stairs again. We managed to find accommodation at the Old Sydney Post House and that was superb. There is such a great extreme between good and poor hotels in Sydney, our advice is go for the best you can afford otherwise your hard-earned holiday will be spoiled.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: gwnmiwn
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location in The Rocks, you literally cross the street and go down a flight of steps and you are staring at the Opera House and the Bridge. Lots of places to eat and drink without having to venture far. I loved the charm and character of this old building, even the narrow winding stairs! Small double room that had everything I needed - the shared bathroom was a couple of metres down the hallway and was big, clean and private. Nice roof garden for relaxing with a drink. Staff are friendly and helpful but not intrusive, just how I like them! I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially if you have a very short time in Sydney and want to see the major tourist attractions in a short space of time (I only had a one night stop-over).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Martha
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Sydney and spent four nights there, split between the beginning and end of our trip. I chose the Russell for its great location in the Rocks district, close to Circular Quay and the Harbor Bridge. Since my husband and I traveled with our 13 year old daughter, we got the suite, which is comprised of two bedrooms connected with a hallway and bathroom. This is a historic hotel without an elevator. Some may find this difficult, but the place is charming if you can see past the initial stairs. The beds were comfortable, the bathtub deluxe and the chocolates on the pillow were always welcome. Just the fact that we could walk out the front door of the hotel and walk all over Sydney was just our style. Or - the ferry and the train are about a block away so public transportation was easy. However, we rarely strayed far -- the restaurants, the bridge, the botanical gardens and the opera house were all an easy walk away. We really liked this place.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Trav926
Reviews.Content: We wish we had read the TripAdvisor 11/16/07 (San Francisco, CA) review prior to making our reservation--it mirrors our experience. We appreciate historic properties. The Russell, however, is just old, musty and lacks charm. Further, the hosts were quite rude. There is no elevator/lift and the only access is via a narrow (read one-way) staircase consisting of 24 steps with a turn. Carrying your luggage up the stairs is not an easy feat . When we balked at carrying our luggage up the stairs, the manager reluctantly found a staff person to do so and acted very put out. We booked our reservation based on Frommer's notation that The Russell was "a find". It is not! It was overpriced ( especially when compared to the ambience and amenities offered by other hotels in the Rocks area ) and grossly overpriced compared to other hotels in Sydney. We left after the first night. It was not a pleasant experience and, thankfully, was the only such encounter during our three-week stay in Australia. Spare yourself the hassle and inconvenience that we experienced and find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: SvetaNYC
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. Be aware that you won't spend much time in the hotel anyway and being right on George Street can be priceless. I liked the hotel and its personnel a lot. Breakfasts were delicious as well. One thing is that rooms are located on the second/third floors that requires some climbing up and down the stairs with no elevator. Though it wouldn't be a problem if you have little luggage. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: jjbear
Reviews.Content: The Russell has the perfect location. It's a small, quirky "boutique" hotel directly across the street from the Circular Quay. This was our first trip to Sydney and we were thankful to be so close to the typical touristy action. Upon arrival, we were a bit confused where to check in (past the restaurant and up the stairs), but once we arrived, we were greeted warmly and allowed to check in early (we were so thankful). The staff was all tremendously helpful and friendly. They insisted on carrying our bags up for us, even though we said we could manage. The stairs are a bit narrow and I don't recommend this hotel for someone who may have difficulty with steps. The building itself is dated, but absolutely as clean as they can get it to be. Our room was the standard room with shared bath for $145 AUD. If you want to be pampered, DO NOT book this room. It is very small, with no TV or AC. We found it to be comfortable though and the shared bath was never a problem. The breakfast was adequate for me, but my husband usually felt a little hungry after finishing. A laptop was provided during business hours for your convenience, however we brought our own and the hotel just provided us with a wireless key. The connection in the room was sketchy (as it was not intended to reach that far), but the lobby area is no problem. I loved the small touches that the hotel provided. The sitting room was great with loads of books about Australia and other things. I would recommend the hotel if you can accept the quirkiness that comes with it.

Reviews.Title: “Such great potential...”
Reviews.Author: Ria_UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Feb-2008 for 2 days. It cost $240 a night but with the extra charge for paying with Amex - it cost an extra $20 a night. However the staff did warn about that on day 1 - so if I wanted to I could have paid with cash to avoid it, however I didn't have $500 spare cash. None of the taxi drivers knew where the hotel was. I would suggest saying to them it's just past the "Four Seasons" because they all know where that is. What struck me immediately was what an enormous shame that they didn't use the restaurant. It's on the ground floor - with passing trade from the street - they would make a fortune on it! This is not a place for unwell, unfit or disabled people. The stairs up to reception are rather steep & quite narrow. I found it a little bit hard to get my small suitcase up it. Then once you check in - there's another long stairway. For me this was not a problem because I'm young and reasonably fit. My room was #14 (en-suite), which is as far away from the stairs/corridors as you can get. The window faces the police station next door. It was a good sized room, had TV, hair-dryer, iron/ironing board, kettle. The room itself is in need of some TLC. You could tell the staff did everything they could to get the room as spotless as humanly possible. However you could see the paint buckling & looking faded & the absence of a fan in the bathroom had caused mould in the past (however the staff scrubbed it with bleach every day so it wasn't actually any mould there anymore). The bed was comfy & clean. The touch of chocks on the pillow every day was sweet. I couldn't get the A/C to work (I could get it to turn on but it just wouldnâ€™t go cold), but there was a ceiling fan to take the worst of the heat. The location is superb, lots of pubs, restaurants, the harbour bridge, opera house all within a very short walk. However the 2 reasons I probably wouldn't stay there again is that I think it was quite a bit to pay $240 a night but the real killer was the doors. Each door is pulled shut to lock (ie there is no handle to do this without noise). On the second night, the people in the room opposite me had no respect. Every time they left the room they would slam it shut. It was as loud as if it been my own door. At 2am one of them went to the toilet (that room is shared bath) and again slammed the door hard enough to wake me up. Now imagine a pair of party people staying next door = no sleep at all. I can only imagine how noisy it would be to stay in one of the rooms of the main corridor. This place could be such a winner if it was just fixed up a bit.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hsgowers
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! We stayed at the Russell during mid December for two nights. It was my first time in Sydney and it was a great place to crash. I don't like the big chain hotels so I picked one with a bit of character and this hotel definitely has that! It is just across the street from Circular Quay, located near lots of bars and restaurants. The roof terrace was a lovely touch as we came back from a long day of sightseeing to sit with a bottle of wine outside. The breakfast was perfect for us to and the free half hour internet was very useful. The only downside was that on a Saturday night there was a bit of noise from the bars below. We also opted for one of the cheaper rooms which also meant that it was a little small, with a view of a wall and we had a shared bathroom â€“ but as we were out most of the time this didnâ€™t bother us too much. It is clean, the staff are friendly, there are tea and coffee making facilities and to stay so close to the opera house and quick subway links around the city for this price was ideal! I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “A character hotel”
Reviews.Author: Regaltours
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first three nights in Aus. Arrived at 07:30 in the morning and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. They provided us with clean towels, allowed us to have a shower, and stored our luggage safely whilst we went out. On our return they had moved the luggage to our room. Downsides were that the room itself was due a spot of decorating, although it was clean and there are some tricky stairs to negotiate up to the reception. Excellent breakfast included in the price, friendly staff and the best location in the city. In the middle of the Rocks area and only a couple of mins from the Opera Hose, the ferries and the bridge. Much better value than the other hotels in the area

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at the Russell Hotel”
Reviews.Author: finnias
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel. It happens to be the ONLY place in all of Australia where we encountered rudeness. The place is overpriced compared to all the other places we stayed during our travels in Australia. It is overpriced for the type of accommodations offered. There is no elevator, only a narrow stairway, up which we had to carry our own bags, no help was offered. The room was sort of moldy, depression era chic (not Laura Ashely chic as stated in the Moon Guide book) complete with peeling paint, no internet and lots of street noise. Not every employee was rude of course, but it really only takes one to make an impression. I would say this hotel is badly managed and overrated. We left in the middle of our planned stay and moved to a wonderful hotel a block away, very clean, very polite, with a beautiful view of Sydney Harbor and the Opera House, FOR THE SAME PRICE. What a relief.

Reviews.Title: “Russell will Rock your Socks!”
Reviews.Author: mariposamaestra
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! Charming and historic, a hotel with alot of character and warmth! The location cannot be beat. You're a two minute walk from the the harbor, the Circular Quay and a breathtaking view of the Harbor Bridge AND the Opera House. The best part about staying at this hotel was the neighborhood, a maze of cobblestone streets and charming restaurants and shops. That being said, it is located on George St. which is lined with a few pubs, restaurants and shops. During our stay on a Monday and Tuesday night we noticed more of a afterwork crowd, not a drunk people spilling onto the streets scene. Our room was not on the street but on a side street and only one night we heard some pub crawlers boisterously making their way back home at 2 am but it was brief and we chuckled thinking how our "pub crawl" lasted only two pubs and we were in bed by ten! Other reviewers have greatly over exxagerated "all those stairs" it's one stairway up and they will help you with your bags(we travel light but we saw the staff helping other people up with thier overstuffed suitcases). Advice to travelers in general is DON'T PACK SO MUCH! Speaking of the staff, they were awesome! Our flight arrived early in the morning. We got to the hotel at 9am and our room was ready to go even though check in is not until 3pm. We were so grateful to come to our cozy room and catch some zzz's after our long flight from California. Our room, though small, had everything you would need: Bathrobes, a coffee press, iron and ironing board, hairdryer, etc. The decor was lovely, the armoir beautiful and all the drawers in the dresser worked(functional and appealing). There were two bathrooms down the hall. One was spacious and pristine with lotion, and shampoo, and body wash. The other was very small; a wash closet on one side to shower and across from it was the toilet seperate but I never had to use this one. The spacious and spotless bathroom down the hall was always available. In the lobby there's a computer available to go on online and the staff was always helpful pointing us in the right direction of a caesar salad that I was craving. However, there's SO many eating options you can't go wrong. The breakfast downstairs was wonderful! You could get a full hot breakfeast with eggs, bacon and toast in addition to cereal, fruit, pastries, juices, coffee, tea... the works! We would fill up on breaky in the beautiful restaurant/breakfast room downstairs and be fueled up for a day of sight seeing. We had such great experience! We would not hesitate to return. We paid $110 a night for a double room. I believe we stayed in the cheapest and smallest room available AND I think we may have paid considerably less considering we got the rooom through a hotel broker at NeedItNow(the australian equivalent of orbitz).
