However, barring a budget I would come back here in a heartbeat. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Just what i wanted”
Reviews.Author: holidaybugeire
Reviews.Content: Myself and my Husband stayed at the Russell for 4 nights on second leg of our honeymoon, October 2006. I know if i had stayed anywhere eles in Sydney i would not have enjoyed my stay. The Russell made Sydney for me, the location, the breakfast and the staff. I would go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel for Budget Traveler”
Reviews.Author: SuperTraveler13
Reviews.Content: After researching and deciding on what we wanted to do in Sydney, we knew that we wanted to stay in The Rocks. After looking at hotel prices, we were beginning think that we wouldnâ€™t be able to afford that. We stumbled on The Russell at another travel website, then went directly to The Russellâ€™s website. Based on our travel style (caviar dreams on a tuna budget), hereâ€™s what we thoughtâ€¦ The Good EXCELLENT location. Itâ€™s directly across the street from the Circular Quay, which is the hub for all water transportation in Sydney Harbour, as well as the train system. Walk a little farther, and youâ€™re at either the Harbour Bridge or the Sydney Opera House. Perfect! Some staff members were friendlier than others, but overall everyone was helpful. They were even helpful before we got there. I changed my mind about room arrangements (we were traveling with a friend who needed a separate room), and they sorted everything out for us before we got there. Weâ€™ve stayed in other hotels with shared restrooms, and this is one of the better ones. Only two to three rooms share a restroom, and they were always clean. A laptop with Internet was available in the lobby from early in the morning until late at night. There was a ten-minute time limit if someone was waiting, but it was free to guests. Breakfast was provided in the restaurant downstairs, the price of which was included in the room charge. It was so filling that we usually had a biscuit or two leftover to take for a snack. We were there in the winter, and the room stayed well-heated throughout the night. The Bad Itâ€™s right across from the Circular Quay and on a main street, so it was noisy. You will need your earplugs. The bed and a large armoire took up most of the space in the room, so there wasnâ€™t a whole lot of room to walk around. Overall If we wanted luxury, we know we should have stayed in a different hotel. But we were quite content staying here and paying half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Lovely Rooms”
Reviews.Author: heieup
Reviews.Content: The Russell is a great hotel in a fantastic location right in the middle of the Rocks. The room we had was lovely, a good size and well equipped with a fab bathroom which was immaculately clean. The rooms are all different as the hotel is a heritage listed building and will vary significantly on view (some at the front, some onto nurses walk and some with no view at all) and facilities (some have air con, some only a fan). Make sure you ask for what you want so that you are not disappointed, obviously prices differ based upon what facilities you want. All the staff were very helpful with loads of useful information and nothing too much of a problem. Help was available with bags if required (up all the stairs). The guest lounge is comfortable and the roof garden is a really nice place to chill out later on an evening. Overall the hotel itself was very good and breakfast in the restaurant a good standard. Other things you ought to know. The hotel is a heritage listed building so there are no lifts. The reception is on the first floor straight up the stairs, you don't have to carry your bags up straight away, you can leave them in the foyer and they will be brought up for you. Assistance is available but you will have to ask at reception first. George street which the hotel is located on is a great location for shopping, transport, sightseeing, eating and drinking but, it is a very very busy road. On an evening there are a lot of boy racers and the neighbouring pubs can be noisy, so don't go if you want peace and quiet after 8pm. No internet connection in the rooms, but a PC is available for guests to use requested at a max 15 minutes per session (no restriction on sessions) in the reception area. Oh and the pack up breakfast was terrible (restaurant breakfast really nice) !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FJ
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from my 4 week trip to Aus, and the first night we arrived in Sydney we stayed at this hotel. When we first arrived we weren't really sure what to expect, having booked it based on the reviews and recommendations on this site. We were not disappointed. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was great, (clean, good view and comfortable)and the location right by circular quay was perfect - we were even upgraded. Overall I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the hotel to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Right on top of Harbour Bridge & Opera House”
Reviews.Author: pinkflower001
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 week trip to Australia with my husband - we arrived at The Russell late on a Friday night and couldn't believe the number of 'boy racers' driving up and down revving their engines and with blasting stereos - it was like Southend sea front!! Unfortunately it was just the same on the Saturday evening but was fine on the Sunday so we guessed it must be a weekend thing! The reason for mentioning this is that as the The Russell doesn't have air conditioning you need to leave your windows open which meant it was pretty noisy! We were okay as we were out and about and don't go to bed until late but if you like being in bed quite early or need peace & quiet to drop off then I would bear this in mind and we were surprised that it hadn't been mentioned before! Regarding the hotel itself - we booked a double room with shared bathroom for 3 nights. The points made previously about there being a lot of stairs are true - if you're staying at the top of the hotel it does give you a bit of a work out going up and down them on a hot day but if you're fit and healthy it shouldn't be too much of a problem! The room was clean but rather tired looking - we found the main problem was lack of space. There were 2 shared bathrooms near us; one very large with 2 sinks and one smaller which were absolutely fine. Breakfast was good and we found the staff to be friendly. We managed to get a little look into the larger en suite rooms and these obviously look much nicer but I'm not sure if it would be worth paying the extra for these, personally if I was going to pay a lot more for a hotel then I would stay elsewhere. The hotel is in a great location (which is what you pay for) for the Opera House and Harbour Bridge but you still need to get train/bus/cab to the other sights that are away from The Rocks area anyway so we came to the conclusion that it's not the be all and end all to stay in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel but great location...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Russell for 7 nights and by the end of it were very glad to leave.. Whilst the location is great - very close to the opera house, harbour bridge etc. the staff are unfriendly (in fact, I found them rude), the rooms are small and very dark, the bathrooms minute and there is no air conditioning, add to that outside noise and lack of security (someone was burgled when we stayed there). Overall, if you are thinking of staying in the Rocks choose somewhere else as this is overpriced for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “It's the real deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here on 2 visits to Sydney, and it is a very nice place. Each room is different, all are furnished nicely. The location is the best in Sydney, right on the harbor, in The Rocks area of the city. Fabulous breakfast, too. However, there is a long winding staircase and no elevator, so not great if you've got a ton of luggage. If you are looking for a hotel with some individuality and soul, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “too hot for comfort”
Reviews.Author: fairtrader
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in february 2005. The room looked nice but the bathroom had no ventilation and there was just a ceiling fan over the bed. Because the room backed onto an enclosed yard there was no air flow. There were also problems with the breakfast being rather stingy for the price and we took ourselves elsewhere (the Rocks cafe over the road is fine). In the end we dreaded going back at the end of the day, knowing we would boil all night even.

Reviews.Title: “Everything at your doorstep”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location. Open the door and everthing is at your doorstep. A great place to go exploring Sydney from. Love the breakfast and staff too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mistralj
Reviews.Content: The Russell hotel is an older hotel with a certain charm to it. The location is the best thing about this hotel - only minutes from Circular Quay, close to the Opera House and steps from great restaurants and cafes. The staff are extremely friendly and helpfull, ready to help with anything, especially your bags, there is no elevator (heritage building). The rooms are small but very cozy, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Not for snobs!”
Reviews.Author: Beejh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Russell during a weekend trip to Sydney. This charming hotel is very well priced considering it's location. It's right in the heart of The Rocks with Circular Quay directly across the road. Even the Opera House is within walking distance which is fantastic. I stayed in superior double ensuite which is a great sized room with its own bathroom. While there I did take a peek at some of the other rooms which is recommended as all the rooms are different. There is definitely a room to suit most budgets. There are only 29 rooms which makes the place friendly & intimate between guests & staff and it is the kind of place that makes you feel right at home with chocolate treats and a welcoming jar of great jelly beans. There is no lift to the hotel due to the building being heritage listed but the staff are really helpful and offer to assist as a courtesy. While I was there I did however notice a young male guest arriving who was less than gracious about the absence of a lift and watched while the female staff carried his bag up the stairs. This is a special place - definitely for the seasoned traveller who appreciates a historical place with lots of character. Not for a guest with pretensions but a slim wallet.

Reviews.Title: “For Backpackers!”
Reviews.Author: Fe3O4
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here if you have a lot of luggage. There is no lift, only a narrow winding staircase. If you are traveling out of a backpack then you will be fine. Stayed at the Russell March 2005. It is in the center of the Sydney Rocks area. The hotel is a historic building and they can not add modern conveniences such as air conditioning and elevators. We stayed only one night. We were glad that we didn't make reservations for more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, nice folk, lousy product. This hotel was the most unpleasant, uncomfortable hotel stay in years. Somebody needs to take over this hotel and turn it into an upscale boutique. Try the Holiday Inn instead, really!

Reviews.Title: “A terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: FredKMadison_WI
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a month in Australia and New Zealand. We chose the Russell Hotel based on recomendations from travel agents and web-sites. I would have to say, that we would never consider staying in this hotel again. The staff was rude and not very accomodating. Our room was located in the front, overlooking a very noisy street, and directly above a tavern with a band that played until 3:00 in the morning. They did move us to a different room for the following three nights, but were very reluctant to make any adjustment for that first evening. Eventually, they gave us $50 off the first night's rate. Anyone seeking a quiet room in Sydney should definitely stay away! Oh, did I mention the 42 stairs we had to climb with our luggage and no help from anyone in the hotel?

HotelInfo.Name: The Russell
HotelInfo.Address: 143A George St. | The Rocks, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
